body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions.-->

**Is this a request for help?** (If yes, you should use our troubleshooting guide and community support channels, see http://kubernetes.io/docs/troubleshooting/.):
No

**What keywords did you search in Kubernetes issues before filing this one?** (If you have found any duplicates, you should instead reply there.):
`kubectl edit order`

---

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?** (choose one):
Bug report 🐛 

<!--
If this is a BUG REPORT, please:
  - Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out
    information, we can't help you as well.

If this is a FEATURE REQUEST, please:
  - Describe *in detail* the feature/behavior/change you'd like to see.

In both cases, be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely
manner.  If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we
might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and
explain why.
-->

**Kubernetes version** (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"5", GitVersion:"v1.5.2", GitCommit:"08e099554f3c31f6e6f07b448ab3ed78d0520507", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-01-12T07:30:54Z", GoVersion:"go1.7.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"darwin/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"4", GitVersion:"v1.4.6+coreos.0", GitCommit:"ec2b52fabadf824a42b66b6729fe4cff2c62af8c", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2016-11-14T19:42:00Z", GoVersion:"go1.6.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

**Environment**:
- **Cloud provider or hardware configuration**:
- **OS** (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Mac OS 10.12.2 (16C67)
- **Kernel** (e.g. `uname -a`): `Darwin oliver.local 16.3.0 Darwin Kernel Version 16.3.0: Thu Nov 17 20:23:58 PST 2016; root:xnu-3789.31.2~1/RELEASE_X86_64 x86_64`
- **Install tools**:
- **Others**:

**What happened**:
When using `kubectl edit` to change the environment variables for a pod, it seems that the _order_ of these variables is not under all conditions preserved. In my case, I was editing the list of environment variables from:

```yaml
- name: SERVICE_PROXY
  value: http://10.1.8.8:80
- name: LISTEN_ADDR
  value: :80
- name: REGION
  value: eu-west-1
```

```yaml
- name: LISTEN_ADDR
  value: :80
- name: REGION
  value: eu-west-1
- name: NODE_NAME
  valueFrom:
    fieldRef:
      apiVersion: v1
      fieldPath: spec.nodeName
- name: SERVICE_PROXY
  value: http://$(NODE_NAME):4140
```

But what I actually ended up with was:

```yaml
- name: SERVICE_PROXY
  value: http://$(NODE_NAME):4140
- name: LISTEN_ADDR
  value: :80
- name: REGION
  value: eu-west-1
- name: NODE_NAME
  valueFrom:
    fieldRef:
      apiVersion: v1
      fieldPath: spec.nodeName
```

Note that the `SERVICE_PROXY` variable appeared *first* rather than *last* in the resulting list. When using environment variable expansion as I am, this is significant: in order for expansion to work correctly, `NODE_NAME` must come before the definition for `SERVICE_PROXY`.

I suspect this is not limited to environment variables and probably applies to any kind of list resource. I haven't had time to dig into the code yet but I suspect that the way the patch is being generated is incorrect.

**What you expected to happen**:
The order of environment variables is as described.

**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
1. Create a deployment whose pods includes two environment variables (let's say `A` and `B`)
2. Edit the deployment to reverse the order to `B`, `A`
3. Observe that the saved order is still `A`, `B`

If need be, I can post a more concrete test case.

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: kubectl edit does not preserve the order of environment variables
